Kun Yang
Vice-Dean
Institute of Blockchain and Data Security, Hangzhou High-Tech Zone (Binjiang)
"Hundred Talents Program" Researcher, Ph.D. Supervisor
School of Cyber Science and Technology, Zhejiang University
National High-Level Young Talent
Email: kuny@zju.edu.cn
Addr: Room 402, Shaw Business Administration Building, Yuquan Campus

Short Bio

I joined Northeastern University in Fall 2020. I earned my doctoral degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from UMass Amherst. My M.S. and B.E. degrees are from UESTC.

Research Interests

  • Hardware Security, Chip Security Architecture, RISC-V Processor Security, Trusted Execution Environment
  • Privacy computing hardware and software co-acceleration, cryptographic algorithm hardware acceleration, AI algorithm hardware acceleration
  • Intelligent connected vehicle security, intelligent vehicle security chip, intelligent vehicle vulnerability mining, intelligent vehicle intrusion detection

Recruitment

I am recruiting graduate students (PhD/Master) majoring in Computer Science and Technology/Cyberspace Security/Electronic Information (Network and Information Security). I also welcome outstanding undergraduate students to do summer internships and graduation projects in my research group. Students who are interested in chip security, software and hardware system security, and intelligent connected car security are welcome to contact me. Excellent graduates can be recommended to continue their studies at well-known overseas universities or work for top technology companies in the industry (such as Huawei, Ant, Nvidia, Horizon, Geely, etc.)
